meanings.definition: Cause or arrange for (something) to take place at a time later than that first scheduled.
meanings.sent1: I will postpone the meeting until next week.
meanings.sent2: Let's postpone the picnic due to the rain.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to postpone the rabbit's appearance, but it hopped out early.
meanings.sent4: She decided to postpone her dreams, hoping they would bloom brighter in the future.
meanings.sent5: The decision to postpone the surgery weighed heavily on his mind.

meanings.definition: Delay until a future time; put off.
meanings.sent1: We need to postpone the game until the field is dry.
meanings.sent2: Don't postpone your homework until the last minute.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to postpone bath time by hiding under the bed.
meanings.sent4: His fear of failure made him postpone taking the test.
meanings.sent5: The chef had to postpone the dessert due to a missing ingredient.
